intro: Gilia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This annual herb typically grows up to 1 meter tall, featuring slender stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to violet, often with a white throat. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
